body.p:
State of Kentucky
Jefferson County sct

This day Wm Brown appeared before the undersigned and stated under oath that he was with Charles Hawkins at the time of his difficulty with Thomas Murray for which he was sentenced to the Penatentiary, when said Murray approached said Hawkins holliering at him in a loud voice in menacing language to which Hawkins said to him, why are you pursuing me on the streets in this manner when you Know said enemies who only wish a pretext to annoy and give one trouble -- but Murray being drunk still pursued him, when Hawkins turned upon him and cut him two or three times with the small old Carlow Knife, which is now shown me that the act was one of sudden impulse on the part of said Hawkins and without any previous malice whatever as both him and Murray had
been on terms of friendship up to that time
Subscribed and sworn to by the afsd Wm Brown before me this 7th day of Jany 1861

G W. Chambers
Examiner of J C C

Also Thos Murray, the prosecuting witness who had the diffculty with charles Hawkins, who states under oath that he was under the influence of liquor at the time he pursued said Hawkins as stated in the foregoing affidavit of Wm Brown and has no doubt that he was to blame for so doing which he regrets and so stated at the time of the trial of Hawkins, as he did not wish him harmed, feeling satisfied as he did, that there was no malice in the act as they had always
been friends
Subscribed & sworn to by the above named Thomas Murray before me this 7th day of January 1861

G W. Chambers
Exr of J C C
